page.title: 06POPULATION MOVEMENT,ST JOHNS
page.content: The residential suburbs,south of St Johns,are mainly owner occupied houses with a few Army married quarters.A third of all the houses are post 1960,& lie mainly in Lower Wick. There is considerable movement in the property market,with a large proportion of newcomers to the area. A survey conducted among 200 families showed that 65% of the heads of family were born outside Worcester;of these,33% came from Hereford & Worcester County;23% from Birmingham & the Midlands;15% from the North of England;10% from Wales,Scotland & Ireland & 9% from London & the Home Counties. The main reason for moving to Worcester was employment,many seeking jobs here because they liked the area Several Army families have bought their own homes on leaving the Service
